Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you can stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Ardi2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed here only one night and it was the worst place I have ever slept at. Especially the dirtiness was a big problem and I will never stay again at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Dont' go!!!!”
Reviews.Author: anna j
Reviews.Content: Yes the price is attractive but don't go!!! It is dirty, there was hair in the washroom and the worst part, me and my friend were bitten by INSECTS during the night and we had a terrible allergy for many days. I even saw an insect on my pillow when I woke up. So if ever you decide to go, it is at your own risk!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible horrible experience!!! THIS PLACE SHOULD SHUT DOWN!”
Reviews.Author: BnZk_2c
Reviews.Content: Dirty, dirty, dirty!!! The room smelled like cigarette smoke and dirty socks. The comforter and bed sheets had holes in them and had a bad smell-- probably wasn't washed in a long time!! So we slept in our clothes on top of the comforter. Little did we know it was infested with bed bugs and we ended up waking up all night long because we couldn't stop itching and scratching all over. We had bug bites all over and especially our legs. Red marks and rashes bigger than the size of a dollar!!! I had to see a doctor and still have scars (now brown all over) to show for it. The better business bureau needs to know about this place and shut them down!! And way overcharged-- we paid close to $150 dollars for one night during the film festival because we couldn't find a hotel at the last minute that was reasonably priced and close to where we needed to be. Had we known how awful this dump would be, we would have stayed elsewhere and paid more. Wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy! STAY AWAY! And furthermore, the t.v. was broken, the paint was peeling, the carpet was old and smelly, a big hole on the wall under the sink by the pipe, the towels were soiled, and we found dirty hair still in the bathtub from the previous customer. We did not want to eat breakfast there! Couldn't imagine the health hazard and unsanitary conditions in their kitchen. We left first thing in the morning thoroughly disgusted!! This was the worst place ever hands down. The staff does not care at all!!! If they did they would have done something already! Wish we had read the reviews before we booked. Be smart and STAY AWAY!!! And save your money and your health. Big big disappointment. Shame on them for doing business this way. This place should shut down before they face any legal issues!! I want my money back!!! A vacationer's worst nightmare -- ruined our entire vacation in Toronto. Read all the customer complaints about this place and take it to heart. You're better off camping outside.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs in the bed and dead bugs in the bathroom dirty dirty”
Reviews.Author: puremega
Reviews.Content: First time I have ever left a hotel. I was in room 4 on the main floor. I can't explain how gross this was. I was put off during my hour or so in the room before I pulled back the bedspread to go to bed and found a bedbug. I found two more (took some pictures) and left. Front desk was useless. If you stay here after being warned you deserve to take bedbugs home with you. If they paid you it wouldn't be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Ineffably Lousy”
Reviews.Author: rob01_au
Reviews.Content: If you are quite well travelled you tend to take the bad reviews with a grain of salt, characterising that the reviewer is perhaps one of those that doesn't seem to understand the 'you get what you paid for' notion. This is not one of those cases. It is one of those hostels/hotels that are so dirty and depressing that they actually make you smile, or perhaps even laugh (depending on your own personal reaction). Anyway having originally booked a dorm room, we were upgraded to a private with cable tv included due to reception not having the right keys for the door. It was at this point where the overall filth wasn't such an issue as i had a reasonable trade off, however that was until the bed bugs came out. In all my years of travelling this was the first time that i had been bitten (eaten), which does heighten some naivety as to how incredibly itchy the bites really are. However if you are short on cash then there's still a chance that you might book a night here anyway, but despite it being cheap be mindful that there is no added value. The disappointing part is it could be a lot better but no one there seems to care.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but not so clean”
Reviews.Author: Lumotin
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, easy to go to everywhere. Little bit dirty. Breakfast was poor. Rooms are very small and there is no ac. Yard was very nice front of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fair”
Reviews.Author: MarisseC
Reviews.Content: Actually, after being really happy for having found a place so near downtown and the beaches at such a price, I read the reviews and got reallly scared. But the horror stories were a bit overstated. The place is old but the guy at the counter was really courteous and willing to help. The room was small and not updated but clean, As we were 4 people sharing the room, we asked for more towels which we got. There was space in the small 5 spaces fenced parking (parking 10$, like any other downtown parking).There were muffins and buns for breakfast but hey, it was free (included) so we did not leave on an empty belly. So, overall, my evaluation is '' fair''!

Reviews.Title: “Low expectations to begin with”
Reviews.Author: Gage L
Reviews.Content: I'm not one to nitpick at hotels, especially hostels. I was well aware of what I was in for before I stayed at the Downtowner Inn. For paying that little money a night, I knew I couldn't complain about much. But really... what is up with this place? It has to be the most depressing and run down joint I've ever been to. I was asked for drugs twice on my 2 minute walk from my car to the lobby. Whatever, thats fine. But how can they even run the place in the manner in which they do? Aren't there some safety and health regulations in place they have to follow? The electrical outlet in my room was ripped out of the wall, I turned on the shower only to watch a few beetles fly out. I was curious, so I asked the guy at the front desk about bed bugs. It was a general question - have they or have they not experienced them? If they did, they can keep their 20 bucks and I was willing to stay somewhere else. I wasn't going to argue. But no, he snapped back at me and told me I was lying about the bugs in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “This place owes me a couple stars for saying here.”
Reviews.Author: Marcfromdetroit
Reviews.Content: I've been to hotels/ motels all around the world and this dump , by far, is the worst. Cigarette butts under the bed. The bathroom felt like gravel because every tile was racked amazingly up. The beds mat have en recovers from a dumpster. POW prisoners have got it better. AVOID at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!!! Do not stay here! We had to bring bed bug spray & it's filthy!”
Reviews.Author: Missblues
Reviews.Content: My husband wanted to get a hotel thought this was a good price for staying 3 days 2 nights there. Especially since coming from buffalo to just for a concert. They have u pre pay online well I guess we definitely shoulda looked at the reviews. We had to pay $10 to park in there own parking lot, when we walked in the room there was a rodent trap on the floor, the showers were disgusting, we didn't get no breakfast nor even seen anywhere that could be at, Internet wifi was horrible. No cable on the tv in fact it was all static and we only had one channel that worked good enough to watch, no fridge nor any place to hang our stuff or anything, they give u one towel per room and a bar of soap that looked opened and old ( thank god we brought our own towels and soap), they don't come clean Ur room at all or even remake the bed, the ceiling had water damage. And the service is ok but if u asked them about any good suggestions on places for the downtown area no one knew of anything. But the worse part was when we were walking back to our hotel and walked on the next street over there was a garbage dumpster and on the ground was a bunch of prescribed medication bottles on the ground still with pills in it and right next to it is the emergency housing for the homeless but the ones we seen were either drugged up or drunk bc u could smell it. Horrible horrible horrible!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it! Don't do it! DON'T DO IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: dan_deckchair69
Reviews.Content: I'm not one that likes to complain, but wow, wow, WOW! Doesn't look like the place has been cleaned let alone refurnished in the last 20 odd years - everywhere you look things are broken and falling apart. Dirty, dingy and disgusting. Room key was that old and worn I needed instruction and a demonstration on how to open the door. The dorm is extremely old and tired with shocking beds that the linen doesn't come anywhere close to fitting on. Hang on, here's a positive - the ensuite bathroom was half decent. Woke in the morning to the pleasant itch of bedbug bites, and lots of them. I was advised just to move to a different bed in the dorm. Of course the bedbugs hadn't contained themselves to only one of the beds (what a surprise... NOT!), so another wake-up call of super-itchy welts. No word of a refund upon checking out, just a "sorry about that" and "I'll let my manager know". Fantastic. But hey, lets try and end this on a high note... hmmm, I'll get back to you on that one.........

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in 30 years of travel”
Reviews.Author: GaryStratton
Reviews.Content: Waited 5 hours to get towels, no tea or coffee facilities, room dirty, but biggest disapointment was that the internet booking was for included breakfast--what a joke!! 2 thin "pancakes" made from a raw biscuit package, no juice of any kind or cereals.On complaining to front desk we were told "I only work here" G and J Stratton New Zealand.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeroenH1987
Reviews.Content: We have been to this hotel for one night during our trip to Toronto, Ontario. We arrived late at night (around 1.30 a.m.) and there was a double booking, so there was someone else in our room and one of the girls in our group had to stay in a girl dorm room. Neighborhood: I didn't like the neighborhood at all, I think it was real criminal over there. Also the tire of our car was stabbed, so we had a lot of trouble getting a new tire for getting us back to Ohio again. The room: When we came into the room, there was a strange smell, the carpet was dirty, there was a lot of dust and there was a lot of mold in the bathroom. There were also bed bugs in the beds. We also felt that illegal stuff was dealt from the hotel. Breakfast: The hotel was including breakfast, this was nothing more than two (tough) pancakes. Wifi Internet: Not working at all.

Reviews.Title: “One word: Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: michaelclarke1986
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely filthy. It is riddled with bed bugs and nothing is clean. The internet doesn't work and the neighbourhood it is in makes you worried there will be a drive-by at any moment. The rooms smell of mould and dirty laundry and everything is falling apart. DO NOT STAY HERE. DON'T DO IT, FOR THE LOVE OF GOD.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: truthfulreviews101
Reviews.Content: Even if the place is cheap there are hygiene standards that need to be maintained. This place firstly smelt of mold and the floor was dirty. There was one towel between 5 people that were staying in the room. The soap they provided us with, had the consistency of butter and looked very old. The bathroom was disgusting, no one showered while we were there because it looked so dirty. The ceiling fan and heating around the toilet didn't have covers and were dusty and moldy. The ceiling fan came on when the light for the toil;et was turned on and it made a horrible rattling noise. The floor in the bathroom area was broken and the fridge didn't work and again, smelt like mold. One of the beds were broken and wasn't suitable to be slept on. The bed were flithy and didn't smell clean. There we no bed bugs unlike some of the other posts, but they were definitely not clean. The 'heating' was blowing out cold air, and was really loud. The curtains didn't close properly and were breaking off the rails. The door locked but it was shifty lock. WIth the parking, they have a few spots but you have to pay $10. We went to park at the back of the building and it had just snowed and they hadn't had time to shovel the snow, but still wanted us to park in 1/2 meter of snow and pay. We couldn't get the car in there to start with. So we parked on the angle at the front of the building, half on the road and still had to pay. So if you have a car be prepared to still pay for a 'parking' spot. When we tried to talked to the Indian gentlemen at the reception he was very rude about the situation and was adamant that we still had to pay and because they didn't have time to shovel the snow, we'd still have to park there. The internet in the rooms was very slow, they firstly gave us the from connect and password so after asking why it wasn't working they have us another username and password. But the connection was terrible for using a browser page, let alone trying to skype. The breakfast wasn't great - bland pancakes with tin fruits. The common room upstairs smelt like cigarette smoke and again was just dirty. The location was ok, it was close to the shopping area, but you need a car to get to Korean town, Greek town, Harbour front, Little Italy, Don't stay here, pay a bit extra and stay somewhere else if you appreciate hygiene.

Reviews.Title: “I have a test for you”
Reviews.Author: Matt2221
Reviews.Content: Ok. I want you to type in "Downtownner Inn Toronto" on to Google.Enter the site and click the "prices" link in the Red search bar on the left hand side. Now You will see prices. There is a weekly price of $100.00 in the winter months ( December to April ) but no matter how hard you look on the site there is no option to book it. So try ringing them and booking the $100 week and what will happen? The staff will pretend it doesnt exist and they will be incredible rude. Try it yourself! seroiusly even if you dont intend on booking try getting the advertised price.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Halfjapspat
Reviews.Content: Sat on the bed for 10 minutes and a bed bug was already trying to make me his dinner. Living in the seams of the mattress and crawling up and down the bathroom walls. There continental breakfast is 2 thin dough luke warm pancakes and super watery orange juice. Not what you expect that's for sure. Beds are super creaky with holes in the comforters and sheets. Had no info on when/ if at all there would be people to look after the bed bugs. Laundry gets thrown on the floor outside the rooms (bed bug home waiting to happen). Small towels no amenities gross looking furniture dirty kitchen. Kitchen lady is very quiet but seems nice enough. The manager was understanding since I booked 5 nights instead of 3. Probably to compensate for the bugs but who knows. I wouldnt stay here again. It definitely should not have inn in they're name. 2 out of 10 only for the price you pay

Reviews.Title: “Real basic”
Reviews.Author: Rainy81
Reviews.Content: This place is really basic. You get what you pay for but spend a few bucks more and find somewhere a little nicer. Staff were pretty much uncooperative, needed change for the dryer and she just ignored me :-(

Reviews.Title: “What a dump. Its a hostel pretending to be a hotel. Horrible.”
Reviews.Author: phenry999
Reviews.Content: Dirty, noisy, cold, beds that sag and creak. Bugs, holes in the shower wall with bugs coming and going. Mildew all over the bathroom walls and in the shower.: Breakfast: two thin, cold rubbery pancakes and watery coffee. This is a sleazy hostel, not a hotel. Yet their website makes it appear as a decent hotel. For the same price you could get a clean and comfortable B&B in the same neighborhood. You have to ask them to clean the rooms, otherwise they are not serviced. Not even drinking glasses in the rooms! No trace of a tiny bottle of shampoo. Really disgusting. I paid for three nights before seeing the room. My advice: put this place on your black list of "places never to stay."

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel/hostel I ever saw in my life”
Reviews.Author: DG_BG
Reviews.Content: Disgunting rooms, durty, awful beds (broken, instable), everything old with NO maintenance. A couple of bugs and insects species were found every public area including rooms,.. laundry is probably their habitat, awful... Towels with stain and wholes,.. no amenities, nothing,.. Bad internet wifi signal, it doesnt work from the rooms and it fails even beside the reuter. Completely shared-dirty-kitchen, smelling bad, trash everywhere, dirty sofas, a bad quality coffee with raw pankake (coffee+pankake) done by a quiet lady; better to buy your own 50 cent toasts. I can not even tell my "worst enemy" to stay at this place,.. please pay 20 dollars more and stay in a minimum standard (e.g. clean) a place can offer you.

Reviews.Title: “Hell on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Tamthadiva
Reviews.Content: This place was awful.. Booked the reservations through orbit for two nights.. Big mistake! We walked into a war zone battle between dust mites and fleas.. It appeared that the dust mites won the battle as there was a dead flea(or whatever it was) smashed against the wall..literally.. Dust mites defeated most of the room.. The TV wires, remote control, and all corners of the room were buried in dust.. NO LIE.. As if all that wasn't enough,sitting on the bed made my entire body itch..probably due to the bed bugs.. This place was horrible and gave me the creeps..NEVER AGAIN.. Even a cab driver who dropped us off to the hell hole didn't recommend the stay. He informed us not to walk through the park afterdark as there is a 100 percent chance that we would get mugged! If you're thinking about staying here DON'T DO IT unless you're looking for something comparable to a homeless shelter(no offense).. There's no way conditions at the downtowner inn are legal.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here, beds are broken, holes in walls, no sleep at all!!!”
Reviews.Author: koppes
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in the middle of Toronto and therefore I choose it. It never tells you in there title it is a HOSTEL and not an "INN". It is just that, a HOSTEL, a very bad one with broken beds, sloppy bathrooms with peeling paint of the ceilings, holes in the wall, electric outlets who don't work, Cable TV that is very bad, etc.. We suppose to have 2 double beds, but 1 bed was like sleeping on a jigsaw, because the feet of the frame were broken and the had put some wood and a wooden pallet under the bed, so when we inspected the room it looked all fine, until you start to try to sleep, which we didn't for the whole night. The other bed was so sunken into 1 side that it fell you were going to roll down a hill. If this is not enough, breakfast supposed to be until 10 am, and after a sleepless night we tried to get up at 9:35am and reached the breakfast room at 9:45am and breakfast was gone!! We complained several times, first we got"we send maintenance", second time we asked to change to another room, but there reply was no rooms available, third time i finally had a choose of 2 rooms: one someone had smoked in(against there non-smoking regulations obviously), the other one the airconditioning didn't work and you couldn't open the window)it was 33 Celcius/ 94 F. that day in Toronto. They didn't want to give my money back at first for the next night, but my kids and my wife couldn't stay one more night there, and after my wife complaining for about another 20 minutes they finally gave our money back for the coming night, although we hadn't slept the previous night. A true nightmare of a Hotel, because it is really a youth hostel and even a bad kept up HOstel.

Reviews.Title: “don't look any further if you like odor and dusty”
Reviews.Author: siriwat007
Reviews.Content: Odor small together tone of dust deposited at the air conditioner. Carpet was so wet and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty much what I expected......”
Reviews.Author: helooo99
Reviews.Content: Went to Toronto for a evening party and needed a place to pass out. I live about 40 minutes away and took the GO bus into Toronto. I was staying with my sister and we had plans to go and party for the night. What we almost did was pass up our tickets and hang out with the backpackers. What a interesting group of people that were staying there. We had a private room that had two beds in it, with a bar fridge and tv. Never turned on the television but the fridge worked. The place was clean enough for the rate they charge. I would stay ther again for the price they charge. It's location is central. I walked from Union Station in 20 minutes. I would recommend taking a cab in the evening the area is a bit sketchy. My sister and I agreed that it was a neat place with lots going on. We met lots of new and interesting people if you are a people person and like that kind of thing. I could have hung out with them all night and chatted. I liked the court yard in the front, it was private from the street. I really enjoyed my stay. Breakfast wasn't much but there was a girl making pancakes in the morning and she did offer me some, I was a bit hungover so I made a cup of tea and went back to my room.

Reviews.Title: “Its okay its not that bad”
Reviews.Author: Ciem
Reviews.Content: okay so i went there last monday March 29 2010 with my partner. It was okay, you get what you pay for. Everything is clean bedding, bathroom etc. The only problem we had was the television, we asked the maintenance to fix it and so he did. But when we looked for channels , only channel 5 was working lol. We didnt complain again because they are friendly, we stayed there for just a night so its no big deal. We had a laptop, so we were okay. The space is good but its not that big. But all in all , its okay, its normal. You just get what you pay for :)

Reviews.Title: “Do not go there!! There was sperm on my bed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sysy1
Reviews.Content: everything was disguting!! its smell bad, its dirty, i couldnt open my door due of many holes in the wall! i came and checked in because i couldnt find nowhere else to stay, we went downtown to visit, and when we came back, THERE WAS SPERM ON MY FRIEND"S BED!!! and we went to the reception to advise the guy who was there, he was sleeping so hard, that we had to yell at him!! finally he woke up and we wanted a refund but he told us, if he do that he would be fired right away! so he said to come back the day after to talk to the manager, we came back, the guys who where there said the same thing, to come back again, we did, finally we met a guy who gave us only one day refund unstead of 2, he said the manager authorized him to give only 1 day......BUT I FOUND OUT THAT THE MANAGER WAS HIM!!!!!!!! he said the he was calling me back ....we are now 3 weeks later... AND IM STILL WAITING!!! we knew that he wasnt gonna give us our money back anywayz!! but people listen carefully please!! even is the the cheapest hotel ive ever been, even i dont expect a sauna, a pool or anything flike thet for the price that i paid, DO NOT GO THERE, EVEN THEY GIVE YOU A FREE NIGHT TO APOLOGIZE (like he did with me!!)

Reviews.Title: “Quite simple if you expect a hostel you will be happy, if you expect a hotel you will be dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: sat2002
Reviews.Content: Coming from a person that has worked in the travel industry for over 10 years in the UK and in many overseas destinations I feel that it is unfair that many UK companies are selling and advertising the Downtowner Inn as a hotel it is not only unfair to the traveller but also unfair to the Downtowner Inn as people are arriving with high expectations and should be arriving expecting a hostel it really is that simple advertise correctly and people will be happy with the end result. The location is fine, within walking distance of the cities main attractions and transportation links, the price is good when you pay about Â£40-Â£50 per room per night between 2 of you it is great! But you need to know what to expect or it could spoil your trip to Toronto. If you are a 'normal traveller' by this I mean you are not backpacking you are a typical couple or husband and wife coming to Toronto for a city break and just want a reasonably priced weekend away then this is not the place for you, pay the extra Â£15-Â£20 per night extra and stay in one of the other hotels in the city(there are plenty). If you are travelling on a real budget, backpackers, students and simply want a place to crash and really dont care about making your own bed, a slight rip in a bed sheet or flaky pain work then the Downtowner will be fine and you will probably meet some great people there as well. The internet is free to use in by the main entrance, breakfast is included simple but adequate! pancakes a banana and a coffee did me for breakfast and the staff that I spoke to were friendly. Like i said expect a hostel and you will be fine, expect a hotel and be set for dissappointment and like I said again I dont feel it is the Downtowner Inn at fault it is other websites mis-representing the property, so dont give them a hard time if you do arrive and it does not meet your expectations. Toronto is a great weekend away so where ever you end up enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL ROOM EVER”
Reviews.Author: elisabethauger
Reviews.Content: There were ants on the floor and holes in the walls. I could see in the other room. Hair on the bath, chewing gum on the floor. I slept with my shoes on. I was disgusted. Worst Ever.

Reviews.Title: “Actually Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: TraveltheWorld50
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a dorm and found it great value for Toronto. A lot of the negative reviews are from Americans who do not seem to understand the property or the location. The property is actually better described as a backpackers than a motel; so yes you do have to make up your own bed, get used to it at that price; yes the breakfast is just bread, spread, jam and tea or coffee but what do you expect for the price; and the internet and local calls are free which is better than the expensive places. As to the location, it is Canada which means that while the property is not in the most salubrious part of Toronto the lowlifes are quite unlikely to have a gun so just relax and enjoy yourself; there is a lowlife area called Regents Park several blocks SW of the property but that is the opposite direction from the tourist attractions of Toronto, if you approach the property from Yonge along either Gerrard or Carlton you should be fine, day or night.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay here”
Reviews.Author: worldview50
Reviews.Content: Please read before booking to stay here, I found the area in which the hotel is base did leave a lot to be desired, I did not see any hookers, but I did see a lot of drug addicts, and that was during the day, I checked in to the hotel, and they put me in a room that looked like it had not been cleared, Ever, when I asked to be moved they did move me to another room, but this one was even worse, I can not say that much about the room, other that door had looked like it had been kicked it, as there was a big hole in the wall where the door handle had been imbedded in to the wall, and there were 4 more holes in the walls of different sizes, I can not tell you what I think was the cause of these holes, but the room had a very strong smell of detergent, the bathroom was dirty, the bed sheets were unclear, and the moment I sat on the bed I started to itch, the cupboard in the kitchen was hanging off, I lasted long enough in the room to take pictures and then leave, I went down to the front desk, and asked to speak to the manager, I was told that he was not there, so I asked for another room, and was told that there was no more rooms, I then asked for a refund, and they told me to speak to the company I booked with, which was ebookers, I have travelled all over the world and this hotel, was the worst ever.

Reviews.Title: “Trust others' reviews and stay away”
Reviews.Author: EVLNewMexico
Reviews.Content: I discovered this site only after finding the Downtowner on a web search and contacting them directly. After reading Trip/Advisor's negative reviews I should have canceled my two-night reservation and forfeited my 5% reservation fee. Instead I called the manager who assured me the rooms were clean and the neighborhood safe. Because I was still doubtful when I arrived at the hotel, the night clerk said I could pay for just one night and confirm in the morning whether or not I would stay the second, reserved night. To my delight, the room was refurbished, very clean and quiet. Even though the included "breakfast" was only instant coffee and cheap white bread in a dirty area with shabby carpet, I decided to stay the second night. But when I informed the manager I was staying, he told me to leave. He had canceled my second night and sold the room! He also charged my card for an additional 5% which I didn't discover until my statement came. From now on, I'm checking TripAdvisor before I make any calls.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but no clean sheets”
Reviews.Author: Reisje
Reviews.Content: When you're just a poor student or just desperate for a place to crash, the Downtowner Inn would be the right place. As we arrived the sheets were laying on the beds and they were folded, so we had to make up our own beds. I did see some red bugs and I do think there were some fleas, because I felt itchy and scratching my arms all day after the first night. Our bathroom was okey, we had a satellite tv and a minibar. The parkingarea (15,- CAD per day) is just at the back of the hostel and provides just enough space for 3 small cars or 2 big cars. I would not stay there the next time I'll visit Toronto, but rather prefer a hotel which might not be as cheap, but at least has higher standards when it comes to hygiene.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've Ever Been In”
Reviews.Author: ak32
Reviews.Content: This place is awful. Do not stay here. First of all, Travelocity cited the hotel as having "free parking" which is nice in a city like Toronto. Yeah, right. The free parking was two spaces in this little fenced in alley behind the place. The indian guy at the desk asked what kind of car I had...because the alley and the spaces are so small, anything bigger than a mini cooper won't fit. I tried to park my car there, and the man was waving me forward through the gate, waving me forward, waving me forward, when BAM, my car hits the gate, scratching the paint. Then I get to the room, which is DISGUSTING. Tile floor covered in dirt and lord knows what else (I was afraid to look). My friend and I had to clean the bathroom before we were willing to use it. And, the window (with no screen) had been left open for lord knows how long before we got there, so who knows what sort of insects (or worse) were living in the place. We paid for the room online through Travelocity, and the guy at the desk tried to get us to pay him again. There were prostitutes everywhere, and Travelocity claimed the place was in the "center of downtown nightlife" which I guess means prostitutes cause there wasn't much else around.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: Therapy669
Reviews.Content: I'm used to staying at places with no frills and I wasn't expecting much, but this place was terrible. We arrived at about 4pm and were told the room wasn't ready yet (it would be at least another 30 mins), so we left to do other things. We returned at about midnight and were told "sorry your room is no longer available" (which I had already paid for online a month ago). When I reminded him that we had already paid, he said he would try to find another place to move us to and we sat on the couch by the counter. He insisted that we did not sit there and went to their lounge instead and told us he'd need at least 15 mins. While we waited in the lounge I noticed there were bugs crawling on the counter and sink and I started to become glad that we were NOT staying there. He refused my quest to just get a refund and sent us to a hotel 20 miles outside of town that was more expensive (evidently owned by a relative of his). The directions to the new hotel sent us through several roads that were closed and we got lost a few times. The other hotel went ok, except I was charged full price and told my account would be credited for the money I paid to Downtowners Inn only if the attendant came by and gave them cash (and they told me not to hold my breath waiting for the credit). So in the end I paid for the Downtowners Inn Toronto and recieved nothing but hassle (no room even, despite paying). Please save yourself the hassle and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “They are terrible and dis honest”
Reviews.Author: h1234
Reviews.Content: We have reserved and called three times to confirm our stay. They took every time our Credit card numbers and always this Gashan (Indian Gent.) from reservations answer and they refused to give a confirmation number. At the end the layers denied they received any call from us. Even no reservation. Worst possible experience and worst possible service, worst every thing.

Reviews.Title: “Was fine, get what ya pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Bristol-Flyer
Reviews.Content: Was a little disturbed by some of the reviews before staying here but after being here for a week I have no complaints. Yes its a basic hotel/hostel with crappy paintwork through out. But at the price who cares? I booked a room with ensuite and thats what I got... it was clean and tidy, the water was hot and plentyful and the towels/sheets were clean. Front desk were helpful and knowledgeable about the local area and attractions. As for being a red light district....I saw about 2 hookers 3 blocks away...once. Yes there are some drunks around but they keep to themselves. The location is unbeatable, right between two subway stations and anyway the city is walkable.

Reviews.Title: “The Flea Hotel. Avoid at all costs !!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerDK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on Saturday 14th of July, 2007. We arrived at 11.30 pm with a reservation for two nights and checked out four hours later after being woken up and bitten by fleas in our beds. We contacted the reception, where we were told that we could have our money refunded the next day by the manager. When we returned, the manager Mike Dluhy had us waiting for 20 minutes before attending our complaint. Here we were met with distrust and accusations about bringing fleas to the hotel. He mentioned that theyâ€™d only had â€œgood customersâ€� at the hotel. To begin with, he told us that we could only have a refund for one night and that we still had to pay for the first night. After a one hour discussion with more accusations and a rude attitude, he agreed to a full refund. We canâ€™t recommend a stay at this flea infested hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “sleazy but alright”
Reviews.Author: dogfooddi
Reviews.Content: so it's right by the red light district and the gay district and there are all these reviews about how awful this place is. you're pay 15 bucks a night for a place to sleep, get over it! people are superfriendly for the most part, pretty much anything goes. i walked around the area plenty plenty both day and night and nobody ever bothered me. the owner and staff are really nice people and you can get away with pretty much anything withhin reason of course. this place is not for princesses or divas like most of these bad reviewers apparently. it's simple, clean enough, no frills, and close to tasty shwarma and all the gay bars and a block away from a beer store!!! it's got character, not like a fancy shmancy global travellers hostel chain. you want gritty? stay here. i will admit the "continental breakfast" is nothing to write home about and the computers are slow from all the male residents downloading porn, but nobody said you have to STAY in the hostel all day long. if you're travelling i'd expect you'd be out and about anyway. there is also an adorable raccoon running around on the rooftop. she is named dolores.

Reviews.Title: “Con Men, Thieves, Avoid at all Costs”
Reviews.Author: ahurlbut
Reviews.Content: On Thursday, March 1st, I checked into the Downtowner Inn in Toronto, Ontario. I had made reservations online via their website, which stated I would receive a room with a double bed, a refrigerator, microwave, phone, and TV. I also requested a parking space, which would cost an additional $10 per day. As it so happened, this was the same day that Toronto was hit with a large snowstorm, which I had to drive approximately 4 hours through to get there. I arrived at the hotel and checked in at approximately 9:00 p.m. They had no record of me needing a parking space, but said they did have one available, and charged me the additional $10.00. I asked why I could not pay for both days I would be there and was told that it is assessed each day and I would have to stop in the office in the morning to pay for the next day. I then asked where I was to park and was told it was around back, behind the inn. As I made my way to park, my car was stuck several times in the snow. Another car was parked at an angle in back, which made it impossible for me to park my car without putting it in jeopardy of being hit when the other car left. I went inside to inquire about a shovel to have the parking area cleared and was met with questions as to what a shovel was. After explaining to the gentleman, he told me he would contact the maintenance man, to see if either heâ€™d come shovel the drive or tell the manager on duty where the shovel was. At no point in time did the manager on duty appear to call the maintenance man nor locate a shovel. By pure luck, I found a shovel in back of the inn and proceeded to shovel off the parking area myself â€“ as it was late, I needed to park, and I wanted to rest. Upon turning in for the night, I realized there was no phone in my room, my TV did not work, and I could easily hear the people in the next-door room talking. Throughout the night loud noises, people talking, and TVs awakened me. The check-in papers I received said no loud noises after 10:00 p.m., which was not upheld. At approximately 7:00 a.m., many people were walking through the halls, talking, laughing, and making a lot of noise â€“ which I found to be quite disturbing to trying to get my rest. A continental breakfast was included with the room rental. However, when I went to the area it was supposed to be in, all I found were empty bread wrappers and jelly jars. Even though my reservations were for two evenings, I felt that unless something was drastically done to uphold what I felt were the reservations I had made, I no longer wished to stay in this inn. I went to the front desk and attempted to speak with the current manager on duty, to explain to him that my room was not as described in the online booking information, that my TV did not work, there was no phone, I had to shovel my own parking area, and there was no breakfast available. He proceeded to tell me that if I was dissatisfied with my room, I should have come to the front desk immediately before falling asleep and found a different place to stay. He also informed me that a budget hotel does not have to offer amenities such as TVs and phones, that a continental breakfast was provided upstairs and I must have been too slow to get to it, that it was not his fault nobody called about the shovel or to speak with the maintenance man, and that I should have found a different place to park. I informed him that I would like my money refunded, as I did not receive what I was supposed to. He began to get upset with me and I told him that the customer service I was receiving was horrid, to which he replied â€œcustomer service does not exist in Torontoâ€� and I could â€œtake myself back to Yankeeland where they eat oil and wage war on innocent peopleâ€�. Any subsequent pleas on my part to get the situation rectified was met with more disdain against US citizens, accusations that I was responsible for people being at war, and that I expected too much from a budget inn, that anything that price would be exactly the same. When my husband came to see what was going on, the manager on duty physically threatened him by cocking back his hand to hit him. I attempted to explain that we visit Toronto on a yearly basis and have stayed at many other establishments in the area, for a similar price, but had never had a problem with any of them. He told me that there was no way I could have stayed at those places for those prices and told me that I got what I paid for. He then had another man come in who also told me that I was expecting too much and did not know what I was talking about, since â€œCanadaâ€™s hotel prices never changeâ€� and there was no way I could have ever stayed at any of the other places for a similar rate. Eventually, the manager on duty said he would reverse the charges and that I would have to call to speak with the hotel manager. He would not tell me his name nor put anything into writing, saying his word was good. I have called every day since then, at least twice, and the hotel manager has always â€œjust left.â€� Regardless of what time he is supposed to be there the next day, if I call, he has â€œjust leftâ€�. I do not feel my money will be refunded and will be taking the proper steps to dispute the charges on my credit card. I feel that the Downtowner Inn is a disgrace to the city of Toronto. I have never been more offended by someone than I was there and have never received such poor customer service in all my travels. I do not feel that the hotel manager, Mike Dluhy (not sure of spelling, only pronunciation), runs his establishment in a good way nor does he care about how his customers are treated. Since I have returned to my home, I have been looking up information online and have yet to read a single good review of the Downtowner Inn. It would seem that I was not the first person to be poorly treated at this establishment, nor will I be the last if it is allowed to continue operation.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Fuzzz
Reviews.Content: This place is to avoid at all costs. It is probably the most dirtiest hostel I've ever stayed at. 1) Rooms aren't cleaned every day, as they should be. When they do clean it is not a thorough cleaning ("Orangle Glo" does not count as a disinfectant, especially with a high volume of people in transit!). For the same price overseas, all the bed sheets were changed (including the mattress cover), and everything was thoroughly cleaned (you could smell actual bleach, not Orange Glo) every morning. 2)The trash in the garbage cans were not taken cared of every day, as it should be. They were only taken cared of if someone checked out of the room. Also, I've seen garbage bags in the hallways for at least 24 consecutive hours. 3) Breakfast includes wonder bread, margarine and weak coffee and no milk (for the coffee). For the same price overseas I had better breakfasts. 4) Employees don't know Toronto that well, couldn't even advise of a good bar to go to, and they don't speak English comprehensively. 5) Seen several customers match at the employees because the hostel has a strict no refund policy. So if you aren't happy with the state of the place, whether it's cleanliness, you have a rash from the blankets, or the phone is not working they will not give you a refund. The employees and the owner will only blame you for your problems with the hostel.

Reviews.Title: “basic + cheap”
Reviews.Author: toomuchtoolittle
Reviews.Content: This hotel can only be described as basic, it was very cheap so i suppose 'you get what you pay for', bedroom was clean, bed comfortable and the shower worked. very little natural light into room. Good location (appart from the small park which appeard to be where a few 'locals lived', best avoided after dark) close to subway station and several bars/restaurants in easy walking distance. Breakfast is VERY basic, toast and coffee (self service), one very small dining room with only a few chairs, but you can take items back to your room. Free internet acess on hotel computers - useful when travelling. I wuld say this place is more suited to students/backpackers - not really appropriate for families.

Reviews.Title: “impossible to sleep”
Reviews.Author: volador
Reviews.Content: The area in wich is located is full of drunk people, the room is not clean enough (you better bring sandals for the shower). But the worse of all, is that they allow some people (about 6 persons) to stay in the garden with music until 4a.m. and you can't sleep. We went to complain 4 times and they did nothing. Next day the said they don't have an official complaining book. They promise breakfast, but forgot it: there is only some coffe. You better go to another inn, for the same price we found much more better places than that all arround the country.

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand the complaints about this place”
Reviews.Author: nkg1882
Reviews.Content: After booking this hostel for my first trip to Toronto I was a bit worried about some of the things that were said about this place. How wrong were these people!! The location is quite good, you are only a 10 minute walk from the Dundas Square. The street it was on wasn't ridden of junkies and hookers. The accomodation was not 5 star but it was cheap and cheerful. You were given a free breakfast and you could get free internet access too. The staff seemed to be nice enough and aided me with directions to Niagara and Wonderland. Everyone in the hostel appeared to be happy with the hostel. I was there for 10 nights and would happily go back to the hostel. The only downside was the fact that the cable tv was out. If you are expecting 5 star quality don't go, but you are getting value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Riped off. After seeing the place the week before, I cancelled my reservation. It is a wreck in a bad area. When I got my cc statement, they charged one night cancellation fee. The Book direct agent said that was their policy.

Reviews.Title: “They've cleaned up their act”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Definite advantages were the close proximity to the city centre, free internet access, free phone access, friendly staff, free breakfast (coffee, muffins, doughnuts, croissants). I read that there were issues with pests in the rooms/beds, but when i was there in Jan 2006 it was fine. Cleanliness wasn't an issue either. Look, it's a hostel, so people shouldn't expect fancy little bottles of shampoo. Sure the area isn't in the best part of town, and all the fitting don't match, but I stayed there for over a week and never had any problems at all. You have to keep in mind that they charge less than half the rate of other hostels, so it's a compromise. -female, 23

Reviews.Title: “Beware This place is A scam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the unfortunate misfortune to stay at this horrible excuse of a hotel. The street the hotel is located in is full of druggies and prostitutes. The hotel does not even have a secure main door and the fence in front of the hotel is non existent. At the time of checking in, i had to deal with the front desk agent who could barely speak 1 word of english coherently and when i wnated to pay by creit card I was notified they have no credit card machine...Thank God I did'nt use my cc as there was a very high possibility I would have been a victim of identity theft. I was directed up the stairs to my room, I was afraid the stairs were gonna fall down and seriously hurt myself as the stairs were dangerously un safe & rickety. upon enetring my room, i was in for the best shock of my life, the room had not even been cleaned since the last guest and there was a huge rodent sitting on my bed. I marched down & demanded to speak to the owner, An arogant man of Indian origin introduced himself as the owner Mr. Mike Dewji, when i told him about the state of the room he said i was lying and if i wanted to check out & needed a refund, he basically told me to get lost I also saw many other unhappy guests checking out as apparently they had no hot water for over 24hrs...this in -9 temperaature. I intend to report this matter to the Dept. Of fair Trading and Consumer affairs. My advise stay clear of this hotel if you value your money security and dignity. Look up Pembroke residence in this website to view candid travelers pics

Reviews.Title: “Nasty but i've had worse rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ahsset
Reviews.Content: This place is pretty bad but after traveling Europe for 3 months i was able to tolorate it. I fortunatly travel with bathroom cleaning wipes and after i gave the bathroom a once over it was bearable. The toilet had obviosly not been cleaned since the last people used it. i have to say that i would not recomend it to anyone though. There was also a mouse in our room who came and raided our trash can every night!

Reviews.Title: “For those on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hostel is ok if you are travelling on a budget. The room was quite spacious although the cleanliness was disappointing. The staff, however, were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible”
Reviews.Author: groove2
Reviews.Content: We also booked this hotel on the internent, and Expedia made it look halfway decent on their website. We arrived and it was not in the greatest part of Toronto. They didn't even have the air conditioner in the room yet, but they put it in when we arrived. The 13" tv received one local public station. There was no mirror in our bathroom either and the bathroom and "kitchenette" were disgusting. There wasn't even any shampoo, toilet paper,or soap in the bathroom. The manager lied and said the maid was late. It was 9pm and he said the maid would be there soon. We had somewhere to be so after a few minutes I went to the front desk and caught him coming back from the store with those items. There were bugs in the bathroom and spiders in the bedroom. Underneath the beds was a lot of dust and other crap. They were remodeling at 6 in the morning hammering and banging away after we got home from the club at 5:30am so we really didn't sleep. On top of this, we had a whole big deal with Expedia. The room did not have their credit card machine set up so i was unable to pay at the time and I am not going to. I am also going to contact the Scottish Inn's corporate office in Atlanta as well as Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hostal over the internet for seven nights. We had to leave after one night as a member of my party was very badly bitten by bed bugs which were found crawling all over her bed. I would not advise anyone to stay in this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful Experience - Avoid”
Reviews.Author: SageySi
Reviews.Content: What a terrible place. The room was dirty on arrival! - we had to ask for it to be cleaned. Then we had to ask for it to be cleaned again as their 'cleaning' meant sweeping everything under the beds. The place stinks of cigarette smoke, you just can't get away from it. The staff are totally disorganised, give contradictory instructions which becomes incredibly frustrating. Simple things are lacking, the bathroom did not have a mirror for example and the sink was a kitchen sink not a bathroom one. A place to avoid, better options in Toronto

HotelInfo.Name: Downtowner Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 117 Pembroke Street, Toronto, Ontario M5A 2N9, Canada
